headline: Lowe’s Stock Falls After Earnings. Home-Improvement Demand Still Looks Weak.
summary: Lowe’s  shares were falling Tuesday as the company’s quarterly earnings report failed to reassure investors that the home-improvement market is headed back to normal after years of weak demand.  Lowe’s raised its total sales outlook for 2024 to between $83 billion and $83.5 billion, a slight bump from its previous forecast of $82.7 billion to $83.2 billion.  Recovery efforts in the aftermath of hurricanes Helene and Milton helped drive up the company’s quarterly sales numbers, although Chairman, President and CEO Marvin R. Ellison said in Tuesday’s earnings release that the results were “modestly better-than-expected, even excluding storm-related activity.”
